main_definition: Columnists are individuals who regularly contribute articles, opinions, or analyses to publications such as newspapers, magazines, or online platforms.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person writing regular opinion columns in newspapers or magazines
meanings_and_examples.example: John Doe is a well-known columnist who writes weekly op-ed pieces for The New York Times.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Experts providing specialized articles on specific subjects to publications
meanings_and_examples.example: Jane Smith, an environmental scientist, frequently contributes her expertise as a columnist on climate change issues in various scientific journals.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Individuals who regularly contribute opinion or commentary columns to online platforms like blogs or websites
meanings_and_examples.example: Emily Brown is a popular technology columnist whose weekly articles are featured on TechCrunch, an influential tech website.
